intro: Myosotis nuriae, commonly known as the Nuruia forget-me-not, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and hairy. The plant produces clusters of small, sky-blue flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Myosotis nuriae thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance.
